channel.title: Ho to hide them? | rep++ if you can help
channel.description: How can i hide the files inside my client? also, just have the "run" button there...? and How do i un hide them? Rep++ if you help me and it work :)

item.source: Ho to hide them? | rep++ if you can help

item.title: Ho to hide them? | rep++ if you can help
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“whackatre, post:4, topic:428311”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=531001.msg3878703#msg3878703 date=1325852743]
^ this people will always try to decompile your client so stop thinking about that.

There are three steps in helping though.

  1. delete your java files
  2. add your cache to an area of the pc where nobody will look.
  3. you could give the person a jar
  4. obfuscate the client ( renaming the files in other words…which to say the least is a hell a lot of work)
  5. you could redo the entire client I suppose…rename methods… etc but eventually people will figure out what to do .

[/quote]

Obbing is done easily with a program. I use Proguard.

For example, from this:

        if (i == 14597) {
            itemdata.actions = new String[5];
            itemdata.actions[1] = "Wield";
            itemdata.name = "@red@R@or1@a@yel@i@gre@n@cya@b@blu@o@dbl@w @red@C@or1@l@yel@a@gre@w@blu@s";
            itemdata.examineText = "A pair of very strong fighting claws".getBytes();
            itemdata.dropModel = 14551;
            itemdata.modelZoom = 738;
            itemdata.modelRotation1 = 225;
            itemdata.modelRotation2 = 80;
            itemdata.anInt204 = 0;
            itemdata.modelOffset1 = -2;
            itemdata.modelOffset2 = -3;
            itemdata.maleEquip1 = 14550;
            itemdata.femaleEquip1 = 14550;
            itemdata.femaleEquip2 = -1;
            itemdata.maleEquip2 = -1;
            itemdata.anInt175 = -1;
            itemdata.anInt197 = -1;
        }

to this:

        if(i1 == 14597)
        {
            ay.b_java_lang_String_array1d_fld = new String[5];
            ay.b_java_lang_String_array1d_fld[1] = "Wield";
            ay.a_java_lang_String_fld = "@red@R@or1@a@yel@i@gre@n@cya@b@blu@o@dbl@w @red@C@or1@l@yel@a@gre@w@blu@s";
            ay.a_byte_array1d_fld = "A pair of very strong fighting claws".getBytes();
            ay.f = 14551;
            ay.i = 738;
            ay.k = 225;
            ay.o = 80;
            ay.t = 0;
            ay.e_int_fld = -2;
            ay.l = -3;
            ay.d_int_fld = 14550;
            ay.q = 14550;
            ay.j = -1;
            ay.c_int_fld = -1;
            ay.g = -1;
            ay.n = -1;
        }

Using a jad decompiler.

It’s going to make stealing a bit harder.

Yes, and quite a few people don’t know how to extract Jar files.[/quote]I had no idea there was a program for this 0.o… wow I feel stupid now I’ve been obbing by hand LOL

Read full topic
item.source: Ho to hide them? | rep++ if you can help

item.title: Ho to hide them? | rep++ if you can help
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:3, topic:428311”]^ this people will always try to decompile your client so stop thinking about that.

There are three steps in helping though.

  1. delete your java files
  2. add your cache to an area of the pc where nobody will look.
  3. you could give the person a jar
  4. obfuscate the client ( renaming the files in other words…which to say the least is a hell a lot of work)
  5. you could redo the entire client I suppose…rename methods… etc but eventually people will figure out what to do .[/quote]

Obbing is done easily with a program. I use Proguard.

For example, from this:

        if (i == 14597) {
            itemdata.actions = new String[5];
            itemdata.actions[1] = "Wield";
            itemdata.name = "@red@R@or1@a@yel@i@gre@n@cya@b@blu@o@dbl@w @red@C@or1@l@yel@a@gre@w@blu@s";
            itemdata.examineText = "A pair of very strong fighting claws".getBytes();
            itemdata.dropModel = 14551;
            itemdata.modelZoom = 738;
            itemdata.modelRotation1 = 225;
            itemdata.modelRotation2 = 80;
            itemdata.anInt204 = 0;
            itemdata.modelOffset1 = -2;
            itemdata.modelOffset2 = -3;
            itemdata.maleEquip1 = 14550;
            itemdata.femaleEquip1 = 14550;
            itemdata.femaleEquip2 = -1;
            itemdata.maleEquip2 = -1;
            itemdata.anInt175 = -1;
            itemdata.anInt197 = -1;
        }

to this:

        if(i1 == 14597)
        {
            ay.b_java_lang_String_array1d_fld = new String[5];
            ay.b_java_lang_String_array1d_fld[1] = "Wield";
            ay.a_java_lang_String_fld = "@red@R@or1@a@yel@i@gre@n@cya@b@blu@o@dbl@w @red@C@or1@l@yel@a@gre@w@blu@s";
            ay.a_byte_array1d_fld = "A pair of very strong fighting claws".getBytes();
            ay.f = 14551;
            ay.i = 738;
            ay.k = 225;
            ay.o = 80;
            ay.t = 0;
            ay.e_int_fld = -2;
            ay.l = -3;
            ay.d_int_fld = 14550;
            ay.q = 14550;
            ay.j = -1;
            ay.c_int_fld = -1;
            ay.g = -1;
            ay.n = -1;
        }

Using a jad decompiler.

It’s going to make stealing a bit harder.

Yes, and quite a few people don’t know how to extract Jar files.

item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

neroxx:

How can i hide the files inside my client? also, just have the “run” button there…? and How do i un hide them? Rep++ if you help me and it work

There’s nothing you can do to make them invisible. As long as you can run it, people can always see the files.
